James Mccaren.Robotic Design and Worlds: The boom in scientific discoveries and advancements in technology inspired many artists to think about the future in 2000. Robots were imagined to do unproductive work of everyday life such as: vacuum cleaning, grooming, washing floor, washing clothes and cooking food. However, these robots have only managed some of these tasks.

Vacuum cleaning robots are very successful than most other domestic robot. Millions of vacuum cleaning robots have already been sold and the number is increasing rapidly. They are advanced enough to reach every corner of the home for cleaning without human assistance. They can recharge themselves and have other features included using wifi functions.

The Robotic industry was developing in the 1980s and the public could purchase robotic toys for kids. These toy robots were equipped with microcontrollers that guided robots how to walk, dance and sing. Today these same robots are more sophisticated and can actually respond to kids. Imagine that.

Humanoid robots are the most anticipated kind of robots. Engineers have been working on many complex problems to make this humanoid robot successful. Some of the main problems were computer vision, artificial intelligence, balancing systems and battery timing. One of the most advanced humanoid robot - Honda's ASIMO, Has an excellent balancing system on feet with human like legs. It's complex ai program installed can interact with humans and avoid obstacles while walking.

George Devol and Joseph Engelberger in 1959 became the first people to make a company called Unimation, they designed and manufacted industrial robots. They introduced the first industrial robot to industries. The industrial robots are used for the specialized task in the industries to be performed autonomously.

Robin Oldham.Digital Tech: While diverse teams are better, more creative and get more done, sucessful teams need a good communicator and co-ordinator. Every team needs this person: they are called, a manager. Team managers involve setting team priorities and performance objectives, reviewing performance and methods employed and spearheading the team's decision-making process.

More than 1 trillion dollars in IT spending will directly or indirectly affected by the shift to cloud during the next five years.(Gartner, 2016). The numbers today have surpassed previous expectations. Cloud enables redundancy, simple data transfer and backups, you'll never lose information important to you. Far more secure than traditional storage and processing because it is safeguarded by security experts that are up-to-date with the most recent threats.

Quantum dots (QDs) are small human-made semiconductor particals. Typically, their size goes nothing more than 10 nanometers. They are employed in varied fields including medical, technology, industries and communications.

Run Length Encoding may use a string of bytes to represent part of an image. Bytes are given as 2 hex digits, to identify where key bytes are: you define the binary representation for the key byte, write out the key byte and the bytes that follow on from it. This will give you the data processed into a compressed form.

Phase Change Memory is a type of non-volatile computer memory (NVRAM) that is sometimes referred to as, Perfect, RAM, due to its superior performance characteristics. Phase Change memory is also referred to as PCM and PCRAM. Some industry experts believe PCM may be the data storage technology of the future, replacing hard drives with solid state drives.

Alexa's most popular skill is setting a timer. Guess people don't use stopwatches.

Alexa Skill Kit is a collection of APIs and tools, this handles the hard work related to voice interfaces, including speech recognition, text-to-speech encoding and natural language processing. Alexa can understand a user's voice command when the skils have been defined. Most of Alexa's skills are handled by Alexa's own logic.

Association Rules Operator can generate a set of rules and a set of associated items. When mining text using the operator tokenize, the words in the text must be grouped together and counted. Without some numeric structure, the computer cannot assess the meaning of the words.

Graham Mansfield.Software Development and Application Mod: A poem by Tim Peters named The, Zen, of, Python, can be read by writing import this in the interpreter. Ask me to read The Zen of Python sometime, wink.
You can use an else clause with a for loop in Python. This special type of syntax executes only if the for loop exits naturally, without break statments.
The name of C sharp language is strimulated by the musical notation. Here sharp, represents the written note should be made a semitone higher in pitch.
C sharp has string interning, strings in your application that get compiled gets put inside an in-memory list referenced at run-time.

Private instance variables of a class can be accessed by other instances: only a certain class can access this private instance which includes other instances of this class. This is useful for some comparison methods.

The Zen of Python, by Tim Peters:
Beautiful is better than ugly.
	Explicit is better than implicit.
	Simple is better than complex.
	Complex is better than complicated.
	Flat is better than nested.
	Sparse is better than dense.
	Readability counts.
	Special cases aren't special enough to break the rules.
	Although practicality beats purity.
	Errors should never pass silently.
	Unless explicitly silenced.
	In the face of ambiguity, refuse the temptation to guess.
	There should be one-- and preferably only one --obvious way to do it.
	Although that way may not be obvious at first unless you're Dutch.
	Now is better than never.
	Although never is often better than *right* now.
	If the implementation is hard to explain, it's a bad idea.
	If the implementation is easy to explain, it may be a good idea.
	Namespaces are one honking great idea -- let's do more of those!

More about Vacuums:
According to PCMag.com Vacuums have come a long way. 
	You no longer have to suffer the indignity of dragging around an unwieldy plastic hose connected to a clumsy, 
	wheeled canister the size of a Galapagos tortoise. In fact, you don’t even need to get off of the couch. 
	Though it still feels like a relatively new product category, there are several good robot vacuums available to help you 
	dispose of dust, pet hair and other debris in your home – without needing to lift a finger. For more information please visit 
	the PCMag.com website.
